intro: Eryngium stenolobum, commonly known as narrow-lobed thistle, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage and purple to pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Eryngium stenolobum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
